document.docAuthor: Song, Zi-Wei, Xue, Xiao-Feng & Hong, Xiao-Yue
document.masterDocTitle: Description of seven new species in the genus Diptacus Keifer (Acari: Eriophyoidea: Diptilomiopidae: Diptilomiopinae) from northwestern China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of seven new species in the genus Diptacus Keifer (Acari: Eriophyoidea: Diptilomiopidae: Diptilomiopinae) from northwestern China

heading.emphasis:
Key to
Diptacus
species in China

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Female
genital coverflap smooth or with longitudinal ridges in one rank ................................................... 2

6 Dorsal opisthosomal annuli smooth but uneven, ventral opisthosomal annuli with triangular microtuber- cles
....................................................................................................................... Diptacus sorbusis
sp. nov.

- Dorsal opisthosoma with shallow, longitudinal, subdorsal furrows, dorsal annuli with microtubercles few and weak, ventral annuli with small and round microtubercles.
Diptacus gigantorhynchus ( Nalepa)
, 1892

7 Dorsal annuli smooth
............................................................ Diptacus guangxiensis
Kuang & Hong, 1990 a

- Dorsal annuli with microtubercles
...................................... Diptacus pseudocerasis
Kuang & Hong, 1990 b

10 Dorsal shield design with lines forming cell-like network
........................ Diptacus lonicerae
Kuang, 2001

11 Accessory setae
h 1
absent; each empodial branch six-rayed
....... Diptacus maackiae
Kuang & Feng, 1987

- Accessory setae
h 1
present; each empodial branch seven-rayed
................ Diptacus tristylaus
Huang, 2001
- Female genital coverflap with longitudinal ridges or granules................................................................... 15

14 Dorsal annuli smooth
........................................................ Diptacus platyphyllae
Xue, Song & Hong, 2006

- Dorsal annuli with elongated microtubercles
.............. Diptacus luanchuanensis
Xue, Song & Hong, 2006

17 Coxal area I and II both with granules, prodorsal shield emarginate anteriorly, each empodial branch three-rayed
............................................................................................................. Diptacus wenisis
sp. nov.

18 Female
genital coverflap with short dashes at base, other parts smooth, frontal lobe long and acuminate ...
............................................................... Diptacus sacchari
(
Xin & Dong), 1983
; (
Hong and Zhang, 1997
)
- Female genital coverflap with longitudinal ridges, frontal lobe short and broad....................................... 19

19 Coxal area I with short lines but coxal area II with granules, each empodial branch six-rayed ....................
............................................................................................................ Diptacus camptothecae
Kuang, 1995

20 Female
genital coverflap with granules at base, smooth distally ............................................................... 21
- Female genital coverflap with longitudinal ridges, basally smooth ........................................................... 22

22 Prodorsal shield designed with all lines degenerative, anterior edge of shield with an arcuate line, two arc- uate lines forming an ellipse in which have a “^” design between dorsal tubercles ......................................
.................................................................................. Diptacus liangfengjiangensis
Chen, Wei & Qin, 2004

24 Prodorsal shield design with admedian lines semicircular, incomplete
............. Diptacus rubi
Kuang, 2001

25 Coxal area I with granules, coxal area II smooth, female genital coverflap with granules at base, smooth distally
............................................................................................................. Diptacus mercuriasis
sp. nov.
- Coxal area I and II both with granules or short lines, female genital coverflap with longitudinal ridges.. 26

26 Coxal area with granules, each empodial branch three-rayed, dorsal opisthosoma evenly round .................
.......................................................................................................................... Diptacus zhouzhisis
sp. nov.

27 Prodorsal shield with median and admedian lines complete, dorsal annuli with elliptical microtubercles...
..................................................................................................... Diptacus betulae
Chen, Wei & Qin, 2003

- Prodorsal shield with median and admedian lines incomplete, dorsal annuli with subulate microtubercles.
...................................................................................... Diptacus damingshanensis
Chen, Wei & Qin, 2003

- Coxal area I and II both with short lines
................................... Diptacus songxianensis
Xue & Hong, 2005

29 Female
genital coverflap with longitudinal ridges, smooth basally
.................. Diptacus serrulatis
sp. nov.
- Female genital coverflap with granules basally, smooth distally ............................................................... 30

30 Dorsal shield with median line continuous and frontal lobe broad, dorsal annuli with elongated microtu- bercles, each empodial branch four-rayed
........................................................ Diptacus maddenis
sp. nov.

- Dorsal shield with median line discontinuous and frontal lobe absent, dorsal annuli with spiny microtuber- cles, each empodial branch three-rayed
................................... Diptacus persicae
Xue, Song & Hong, 2006
